title: Marinated Tuna Steak Recipe
description: This tuna steak recipe includes a marinade that's easy to make with orange juice, soy sauce, and garlic for a sweet and tangy grilled tuna dinner.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes BBQ & Grilling Seafood Tuna Marinated Tuna Steak 4.7 (1,237) 921 Reviews 141 Photos This tuna steak recipe uses a tangy marinade made with orange juice, soy sauce, and garlic for a wonderful taste. Submitted by LINKYJ Updated on March 5, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 141 141 141 141 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This tuna steak recipe is impressive enough for company, but surprisingly easy to make. How to Cook Tuna Steak You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Tuna Steak Marinade Ingredients This flavorful tuna steak marinade recipe is made with the following ingredients:  Orange juiceSoy sauceOlive oilFresh parsley Fresh oreganoFresh garlicLemon juiceBlack pepper How to Grill Tuna Steaks Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this tuna steak recipe:  Make the marinadeMarinate the tuna steaks.Grill the marinated tuna steaks, basting often, to desired doneness. How Long to Grill Tuna Steaks On an outdoor grill preheated to high heat, the marinated tuna steaks should be perfectly grilled after about 5-6 minutes on each side. A meat thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 125 degrees F.  Allrecipes Video Test Kitchen Tips “It literally pops with flavor in your mouth,” culinary producer and test kitchen expert Nicole McLaughlin says of this marinated tuna steak recipe. Here are some expert tips and tricks from Nicole:  “Fresh fish from the sea needs fresh herbs,” according to Nicole. “Don’t be messing with the dried stuff here.”Nicole stresses the importance of making sure your pan is “hot, hot, hot” to create the perfect sear. Nicole serves her tuna steaks with a fresh side salad and a squeeze of lemon juice. What to Serve With Tuna Steak Recipe creator suggests topping the tuna steaks with sautéed mushrooms for a flavorful addition. For more inspiration, explore our collection of Most Popular Side Dishes to Serve With Fish. Here are a few of the top-rated recipes you’ll find: Oven-Roasted Asparagus  Spaghetti Cacio e Pepe  Caesar Salad Supreme  How to Store Tuna Steaks  If you have leftover grilled tuna steaks, you can store them in an airtight container for up to three days.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “I didn't have OJ so I substituted fresh-squeezed apple juice from wild apples I had picked last month,” says jeraldo. “Tuna came out moist, flavorful — perfect. Easy to make too.” “Perfect,” raves Melissa Santos. “My family loves to fish and tuna season lasts a lot of the summer. We were looking for a new recipe and this was yummy! I doubled the marinade for about 10 steaks and let it sit for about 45 mins.” “This was amazing as-is,” according to KSBARNES. “No adjustments are needed. I actually cooked on my stovetop, as I was in a hurry, and it came out perfectly!” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ¼ cup orange juice ¼ cup soy sauce 2 tablespoons olive oil 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley 1 tablespoon lemon juice 1 clove garlic, minced ½ teaspoon chopped fresh oregano ½ teaspoon ground black pepper 4 (4 ounce) tuna steaks Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix orange juice, soy sauce, olive oil, parsley, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, and pepper together in a large non-reactive dish until well combined. Place tuna steaks in marinade and turn to coat. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Remove tuna steaks from the marinade and shake off excess; reserve marinade for basting. Cook tuna steaks on the preheated grill for 5 to 6 minutes; flip steaks and baste with reserved marinade. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, or to desired doneness. Discard any remaining marinade. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip Try topping your tuna steak with sautéed mushrooms for a flavorful addition. Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes information for the full amount of the marinade ingredients. Depending on marinating time, ingredients, cooking method, etc., the actual amount of the marinade consumed will vary. I Made It Print 1,682 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Marinated Tuna Steak 01 of 141 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 141 Photo by  JovialFarro2197 07/14/2023 I made this for dinner, and followed the recipe exactly and it was wonderful! I'll definitely be making this again. 03 of 141 Photo by  CrispDate2403 04/08/2023 Absolutely outstanding!!! I marinated for about 5 hours. Used fresh Cilantro instead of Parsley and Oregano. Grilled for 4 minutes per side. I made a gravy from the marinade. I put the leftover marinade into a saucepan and boiled for a few minutes then added a slurry to thicken into a gravy. Amazing!For the slurry, put 2 tbsp Milk into bowl and add 1 tbsp Corn Starch and whisk rapidly…turn burner to low and add slurry to marinade…whisk/stir as it starts to thicken (will only take a minute or so). Remove from heat and serve over Tuna. 04 of 141 Photo by  Kate Young 03/15/2023 I didn’t have orange juice, so I puréed some mandarin oranges. It was AMAZING! 05 of 141 Photo by  ToughBeef7714 08/26/2022 I didn’t have soy sauce or orange juice but with all the other ingredients this was still an OMG meal. No left overs which never happens in this house! 06 of 141 Photo by  ZippyFlan4506 08/20/2022 This was fantastic came out perfect. I grilled it on a charcoal grill for added flavor and char. I can't wait to make it again. 07 of 141 Photo by  LimeKiwi2223 08/05/2022 I cooked a tad too long, but was still amazing! And I know to take off the grill sooner next time. (Please note, I’m NOT a fish lover!) Awesome recipe! 08 of 141 Photo by  stone cold baker 07/10/2022 This recipe is fantastic. I did add the honey and some fresh ginger. The only thing I didn't absolutely love was the oregano. That is just a personal preference though. I may try some tarragon next time. Excellent marinade and super easy! Thank you!I served it alongside grilled sweet potatoes topped with goat cheese and a chop salad. 09 of 141 Photo by  jjohnson197508 02/05/2022 Pan seared with butter and the left over sauce, cooked 6 minutes on each side and let sit for a minute before serving. Then made steamed cauliflower and served, it was great. Thank you 10 of 141 Photo by  pkdeckerbrecipes pkdeckerb 09/09/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Orange Glazed Swordfish 20 Ratings Grilled Cod 208 Ratings Grilled Salmon 5,610 Ratings Grilled Tuna Fish Steaks 27 Ratings Grilled Cilantro Salmon 243 Ratings Garlic Salmon 558 Ratings Super Grilled Salmon 140 Ratings Cedar Plank-Grilled Salmon with Garlic, Lemon and Dill 213 Ratings Grilled Tilapia 14 Ratings Grilled Red Snapper with Lemon Chive Sauce 3 Ratings Chile Garlic BBQ Salmon 295 Ratings Firecracker Grilled Alaska Salmon 1,353 Ratings Balsamic and Rosemary Grilled Salmon 155 Ratings Grilled Stuffed Swordfish 60 Ratings Roasted Red Pepper Salmon Pasta 17 Ratings Grilled Swordfish with Rosemary 190 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: LINKYJ
ingredients: Orange juice;Soy sauce;Olive oil;Fresh parsley;Fresh oregano;Fresh garlic;Lemon juice;Black pepper

Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Mix orange juice, soy sauce, olive oil, parsley, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, and pepper together in a large non-reactive dish until well combined. Place tuna steaks in marinade and turn to coat. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Remove tuna steaks from the marinade and shake off excess; reserve marinade for basting.;Cook tuna steaks on the preheated grill for 5 to 6 minutes; flip steaks and baste with reserved marinade. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, or to desired doneness. Discard any remaining marinade. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
